oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A NUMERICAL SIMULATION OF BEACH EVOLUTION BASED ON A NONLINEAR DISPERSIVE WAVE-CURRENT MODEL
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sato, Shinji
Kabiling, Michael B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave model
numerical simulation
beach evolution
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A numerical wave model based on the Boussinesq equation was extended to the computation of two-dimensional wave-current field including diffraction, refraction and wave breaking. The energy dissipation due to wave breaking was modeled by a momentum mixing term using eddy viscosity. Beach deformation was estimated based on the wave-current field simulated in the nearshore region. Energetics-based equations were used to estimate the total sediment transport in the cross-shore and longshore directions. The model applicability was confirmed with laboratory experiments.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
